1118640422912282624.text:

1117118029442076672.text: @coachella is live streaming all weekend. By the way we talked about how generational music is. One group last night was there because they had, in the past few weeks, become the number one on YouTube. We did so much talking because we just weren’t into modern music that much.

1117116921973882880.text:
The same way I still treasure the moments when I have gotten to experience analog music even though Coachella sounded pretty damn good streaming on the badass audio system in my Tesla.

Nothing like standing in front of a row of subwoofers at Coachella. 

What a future!

1117116920438738945.text: Except there still will be an analog world (we call it the real world) and there won’t be anything like a mother’s embrace even with all of the new haptics and brain interfaces and we still will seek out the analog world.

1117116918987550721.text: And we will feel like we are actually there. And maybe we won’t need to travel much at all. Except Francisco needed to pick some stuff up from his parents house. Maybe we will just send a robot to do stuff like that.

1117116917565677569.text:
...all while our car drives itself through farms and cities.”

I bet no one would believe any of this is possible.”

Then we talked about the R&D we had seen in Los Angeles and wondered how weird 100 years from now will be.

Coachella 2119 will be live streamed to our brains...

1117116916127002625.text: ...fly through the air, find our device as we drive at 80 mph and assemble themselves in the right order so that we can watch a concert live...

1117116914700918785.text:
Francisco said the fact that our car was driving itself was the most futuristic thing he has experienced.

I said “let’s take a time machine back 100 years and tell those people that in the future we would have a device in our hands where trillions of numbers would...

1114708345577861121.text: I've been keeping track of how many Teslas I see near me. It isn't unusual anymore to drive next to three or five Teslas. Imagine a mesh network that uses them? Big disruption. Crazy dreams from Silicon Valley.

1114708344936075266.text: Soon Elon will send me an email asking me to bring my Tesla in to take out the Nvidia card that's doing the computer vision that allows it to drive on freeways. Replacing it with an AI chip that Tesla is building. What if they took out the LTE radio too and added 5G?

1114708342616678401.text: And what if Elon then hooked that network up to a new pair of 5G-ready augmented reality glasses like @rabovitz and @magicleap is building? Oh, maybe that's why AT&T invested in Magic Leap.

1114708342071365633.text: One problem with Tesla's autopilot is that it can't see potholes and doesn't share data from car to car about what's ahead (which is why I use @waze in my Tesla, so I get a warning about debris in road, for instance). Such a mesh network would solve that problem.

1114708341534547970.text:
From car to car to car in a mesh network until it got to a ground-based antenna. 

What if those ground-based antennas talk to satellites overhead? Oh, wait, Elon already has @SpaceX 

I sometimes wonder if Elon is already building this out?

1114708340951605249.text:
The system keeps track of where you are and hands you off from cell tower to cell tower.

So why couldn't the cell towers move around you too? 

Because 5G has nearly zero latency, as @Accenture's CEO points out here: https://youtu.be/mHx8RjbxbSw  a packet could be passed many times...

1114708340460797952.text:
What if @elonmusk put a 5G radio and antenna in every @Tesla ? 

If I was AT&T or Verizon's CEO, that thought would terrify me.

If it happened Tesla would instantly have the best 5G network in Silicon Valley. 

Think about it. You can move around a cell network...

1086675661610045440.text: Anyway these headphones have improved my travel life more than any other device. And I am not paid to say any of this. Find them at Apple stores. They blow the Beats ones away!

1086675659496161280.text: They have lots of other features too because of the app that drives them. Which shows why Apple is forcing to push the industry away from the old jack. Plus, like my Tesla, these got better since I bought them.

1086675656715300864.text:
For instance they turn off the microphones automatically when you aren’t talking so the person you are talking to hears no noise.

I have been in very noisy places and the other person says I sound like I am in a conference room.

1086675653137580032.text: But that is just the start. These phones have a little processing computer that uses all sorts of machine learning to make phone call and listening better.pic.twitter.com/OXtOjuDWyt

1086675645097172992.text:
The Apple AirPods do NOT do this. And don’t sound nearly as good. For the same price.

But these were designed for modern iPhone users. They plug into the lightening port at the bottom of your iPhone. No 1/3-inch jack needed!

And you can charge while listening too.pic.twitter.com/QqFXZjByJe

1086675635236302848.text: Two more down on the cord by your heart. They are the best at canceling noise I have every used. A child can be screaming right next to me and I can’t hear it.

1086675633059463168.text: They are the best headphones I have ever had. By far. Back when I worked at Microsoft a researcher showed me an array microphone that cost more than $10,000. These have one built in. These headphones have six microphones. Two built into the little piece I am holding.

If the new company CEO doesn’t brag to CNBC about the buy he/she is planning to kill the brand/product like when Facebook bought FriendFeed.

I have witnessed dozens of these things from my front-row seat and this thread is based on what actually happened after acquisition.

1086366577711173632.text: If founder won’t talk about who bought them? The new company doesn’t want to let competitors know it is making moves or it just doesn’t want to derail its PR team or it is in some sort of quiet period, like an IPO.

1086366571809800193.text:
Acquisition key:

If founder won’t talk about price? Fire sale. Or acquihire.

If founder won’t talk about team? The team will be split up inside the new company and/or fired.
